Container.Name: MKVToolNix
Container.Overview: MKVToolNix is a set of tools to create, alter and inspect Matroska files. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 100MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-mkvtoolnix/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-mkvtoolnix/blob/master/README.md[/a].

[font size=4][center]MKVToolNix Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.8.2[/b][/font] (2017-10-09) - Now using baseimage v3.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue where nginx config change was not applied correctly on systems without IPV6 support and secure connection disabled.
[font size=3][b]v1.8.1[/b][/font] (2017-10-08) - Now using baseimage v3.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Fixed nginx config for systems without IPV6 support.
[font size=3][b]v1.8.0[/b][/font] (2017-10-07) - Now using baseimage v3.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Better support for service dependencies. - Added support for secure access to the application's GUI.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.0[/b][/font] (2017-10-01) - Upgraded MKVToolNix to version 16.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.6.0[/b][/font] (2017-09-21) - Added support for interface language. - Now using baseimage v2.0.9, which brings the following changes: - Restore default `/etc/shadow` during container startup.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.1[/b][/font] (2017-09-08) - Now using baseimage v2.0.8, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed timezone support on alpine-glibc images. - Fixed duplicated entries in /etc/passwd and /etc/group that were created after a restart of the container.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.0[/b][/font] (2017-08-21) - Upgraded MKVToolNix to version 15.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.3[/b][/font] (2017-08-14) - Now using baseimage v2.0.6, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.20.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.2[/b][/font] (2017-07-31) - Now using baseimage v2.0.5, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Clear the environment of the container during startup. - Clear the /tmp folder during startup. - Cleanly terminate the X server when container is restarted/stopped. - Improved robustness of X server starting process. - Removed unneeded files from the image.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.1[/b][/font] (2017-07-27) - Now using baseimage v2.0.3, which brings the following changes: - Improved robustness of the X server starting process.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-23) - Upgraded MKVToolNix to version 14.0.0. - Now using baseimage v2.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Proper VNC port is exposed.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.1[/b][/font] (2017-07-18) - Now using baseimage v2.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Internal enhancements. - Clean temporary files left by npm.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-17) - Now using baseimage v2.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Various internal enhancements. - Fixed the way a service waits for another one.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-04) - Now using baseimage v1.5.0, which brings the following changes: - Added the UMASK environment variable to control how file permissions are set for newly created files. - Added the X11VNC_EXTRA_OPTS environment variable used to pass additional arguments to the x11vnc server. - By default, activate auto-scaling of application's window. - Applied latest Alpine Linux security updates.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-25) - Display MKVToolNix version during startup. - Updated MKVToolNix to version 13.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.2[/b][/font] (2017-06-22) - Now using baseimage v1.4.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated Alpine Linux to version 3.6.2.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.1[/b][/font] (2017-06-21) - Now using baseimage v1.4.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Associate the application's icon to a unique version to avoid browser cache issues. - Fixed prefix of some service related messages. - Added support for supplying supplementary groups of the application.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-13) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.
